page.title: 02CRUDWELL PARISH CHURCH
page.content: {All Saints Church,Crudwell}was first built by the{monks of Malmesbury Abbey {about 1100.It has been}added to five times since then.The two oldest things left are the 900 year{old stone font {and a Norman door.}The church was built from local stone.It has{several {attractive stained glass windows {including one on the north}wall which is at least 500 years old.The 5 bells in the square tower were rung from 1750 to 1850.The repairs which are now needed would cost thousands of pounds.In the chancel walls there are two slanting holes called squints.They were used by the lepers so that they could watch the service without infecting the congragation.The lych gate entrance was made in the last 40 years as a memorial to the men of the village who died during{the 1914-1918 {war.
